text: Sarfand al-Amar (صرفند العمار) was a Palestinian village located on the coastal plain of Palestine, about 5 kilometres (3.1 mi) northwest of Ramla.219 Its population was 1,950 in 1945 and its land area is 13,267 dunams. Its inhabitants were displaced during the 1948 Arab-Israeli war. == References == Category:Coordinates on Wikidata Category:Mandatory Palestine Category:Ramla District
title: Sarfand Al Amar
